chapter.title: Restful APIs
chapter.para: The RestComm Restufl APIs are very similar to Twilio's and allow you to query meta-data about your account, phone numbers, calls, text messages, and recordings. Through the Restful API you can also start outbound calls and send text messages.

formalpara.title: Resource Encoding
formalpara.para: When an HTTP client makes a request to RestComm for a resource the HTTP client has the option to pick which encoding is used for the response. Currently, RestComm supports XML and JSON encoding. The default encoding is XML but to receive the resource in JSON just append .json to the end of the resource name.

formalpara.title: User Authentication
formalpara.para: Before accepting any Restful API call, Restcomm will need to authenticate the requestor. To authenticate against Restcomm you will need a valid Account and use as a username either the Account's SID or Email Address and for password the AuthToken of the Account.

section.title: Accounts
section.para: Accounts and subaccounts are useful for things like segmenting phone numbers and usage data for your users and controlling access to data.

formalpara.title: Account Resource URI
formalpara.para: /2012-04-24/Accounts/{AccountSid}

row.entry: A string that uniquely identifies this account.
The date that this account was created.
The date that this account was last updated.
A description of this account, up to 64 characters long. By default the FriendlyName is your email address.
The status of this account. Possible values are active, suspended, and closed.
The authorization token for this account. This should not be shared.
The URI for this account, relative to http://localhost:port/restcomm.

formalpara.title: HTTP GET
formalpara.para: Returns the representation of an Account resource, including the properties above.

formalpara.title: HTTP POST/PUT
formalpara.para: Modifies an Account resource and returns the representation, including the properties above. Below you will find a list of optional parameters.

row.entry: A description of this account, up to 64 characters long.
The status of this account. Possible values are active, suspended, and closed.
A password that will be used to generate the AuthToken for the new Account resource.

formalpara.title: Account List Resource URI
formalpara.para: /2012-04-24/Accounts

formalpara.title: HTTP GET
formalpara.para: Returns the list representation of all the Sub-Account resources for this Account, including the properties above.

formalpara.title: HTTP POST
formalpara.para: Creates a new Sub-Account and returns the representation of the Sub-Account resource, including the properties above. Below you will find a list of required and optional parameters.

row.entry: The email address to use for this account.
A description of this account, up to 64 characters long. Default, is your email address.
The status of this account. Default is active, possible values are active, suspended, and closed.
A password that will be used to generate the AuthToken for the new Account resource.

The security role that this Account resource will use. If no role is provided then the role of the account resource creating this will be inherited to the new Account resource and may compromise the system.

section.title: Calls
section.para: A Call represents a connection between a phone or user agent and RestComm. This may be inbound or outbound. The Calls list resource represents the set of phone calls originated and terminated from an account.

formalpara.title: Call Resource URI
formalpara.para: /2012-04-24/Accounts/{AccountSid}/Calls/{CallSid}

row.entry: A string that uniquely identifies this call.
A string that uniquely identifies the call that created this leg.
The date that this call was created.
The date that this call was last updated.
The unique id of the Account that created this call.
The phone number or identifier that will be the recipient of this call.
The phone number or identifier that originated this call.
If the call was inbound, this is the Sid of the IncomingPhoneNumber that received the call.
A string representing the status of the call. Possible values are queued, ringing, in-progress, completed, failed, busy and no-answer.
The start time of the call. Empty if the call has not yet been started.
The end time of the call. Empty if the call has not ended..
The length of the call in seconds.
A string describing the direction of the call. Possible values are inbound, outbound-api, and outbound-dial
If this call was an incoming call, the caller's name. Empty otherwise.
The URI for this account, relative to http://localhost:port/restcomm.

formalpara.title: HTTP GET
formalpara.para: Returns the representation of a Call resource, including the properties above.

formalpara.title: Call List Resource URI
formalpara.para: /2012-04-24/Accounts/{AccountSid}/Calls

formalpara.title: HTTP GET
formalpara.para: Returns the list representation of all the Call resources for this Account, including the properties above.

formalpara.title: HTTP POST
formalpara.para: Makes a new Call and returns the representation of the Call resource, including the properties above. Below you will find a list of required and optional parameters.

row.entry: The phone number to use as the caller id.
The fully qualified URL that should be executed when the call connects.
The HTTP method RestComm should use when making its request to the above Url. Defaults to POST.
The URL that RestComm will request if execution of Url fails for any reason.
The HTTP method that RestComm should use to request the FallbackUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.
A URL that RestComm will request when the call ends to notify your app.
The HTTP method RestComm should use when requesting the above StatusCallback. Defaults to POST.
The number of seconds that RestComm should allow the phone to ring before assuming there is no answer. The default is 60 seconds.

section.title: SMS Messages
section.para: An SMS Message resource represents an inbound or outbound SMS message.

formalpara.title: SMS Message Resource URI
formalpara.para: /2012-04-24/Accounts/{AccountSid}/SMS/Messages/{SMSMessageSid}

row.entry: A string that uniquely identifies this SMS Message.
The date that this SMS Message was created.
The date that this SMS Message was last updated.
The date that the SMS was sent or received by RestComm.
The unique id of the Account that sent or received this SMS message.
The phone number or short code that initiated the message.
The phone number or short code that received the message.
The text body of the SMS message. Up to 160 characters long.
The status of this SMS message. Possible values are queued, sending, sent, failed, and received.
The direction of this SMS message. Possible values are incoming, outbound-api, outbound-call.
The API version RestComm used to handle the SMS message.
The URI for this account, relative to http://localhost:port/restcomm.

formalpara.title: HTTP GET
formalpara.para: Returns the representation of an SMS Message resource, including the properties above.

formalpara.title: SMS Message List Resource URI
formalpara.para: /2012-04-24/Accounts/{AccountSid}/SMS/Messages

formalpara.title: HTTP GET
formalpara.para: Returns the list representation of all the Call resources for this Account, including the properties above.

formalpara.title: HTTP POST
formalpara.para: Sends a new SMS Message and returns the representation of the SMS Message resource, including the properties above. Below you will find a list of required and optional parameters.

row.entry: A phone number that is enabled for SMS.
The destination phone number in E.164 format.
The text of the message you want to send, limited to 160 characters.

section.title: Recordings
section.para: Recordings are generated when you use the <Record> verb. Those recordings are hosted with RestComm for you to retrieve. The Recordings list resource represents the set of an account's recordings.

formalpara.title: Recording Resource URI
formalpara.para: /2012-04-24/Accounts/{AccountSid}/Recordings/{RecordingSid}

section.para: To download the audio file just append .wav after the RecordingSid.

row.entry: A string that uniquely identifies this recording.
The date that this recording was created.
The date that this recording was last updated.
The unique id of the Account that created this recording.
The unique id of the call during which the recording was made.
The length of the recording, in seconds.
The API version in use during the recording.
The URI for this account, relative to http://localhost:port/restcomm.

formalpara.title: HTTP GET
formalpara.para: Returns the representation of a Recording resource, including the properties above.

formalpara.title: HTTP DELETE
formalpara.para: Removes the recording from the account.

formalpara.title: Recording List Resource URI
formalpara.para: /2012-04-24/Accounts/{AccountSid}/Recordings

formalpara.title: HTTP GET
formalpara.para: Returns the list representation of all the Recording resources for this Account, including the properties above.

section.title: Transcriptions
section.para: A Transcription resource represents a transcription of a recording. A transcription is a text version of a recording produced using automatic speech recognition.

formalpara.title: Transcription Resource URI
formalpara.para: /2012-04-24/Accounts/{AccountSid}/Transcriptions/{TranscriptionSid}

row.entry: A string that uniquely identifies this transcription.
The date that this transcription was created.
The date that this transcription was last updated.
The unique id of the Account that created this transcription.
A string representing the status of the transcription. Possible values are in-progress, completed, and failed.
The unique id of the Recording this Transcription was made of.
The duration of the transcribed audio, in seconds.
The text content of the transcription.
The URI for this account, relative to http://localhost:port/restcomm.

formalpara.title: HTTP GET
formalpara.para: Returns the representation of a Transcription resource, including the properties above.

formalpara.title: HTTP DELETE
formalpara.para: Removes the Transcription from the account.

formalpara.title: Transcription List Resource URI
formalpara.para: /2012-04-24/Accounts/{AccountSid}/Transcriptions

formalpara.title: HTTP GET
formalpara.para: Returns the list representation of all the Transcription resources for this Account, including the properties above.

section.title: Notifications
section.para: A Notification resource represents a single log entry made by RestComm while handling your calls or your use of the Restful APIs. It is very useful for debugging purposes. The Notifications list resource represents the set of notifications generated for an account.

formalpara.title: Notification Resource URI
formalpara.para: /2012-04-24/Accounts/{AccountSid}/Notifications/{NotificationSid}

row.entry: A string that uniquely identifies this transcription.
The date that this transcription was created.
The date that this transcription was last updated.
The unique id of the Account that created this transcription.
CallSid is the unique id of the call during which the notification was generated. Empty if the notification was generated by the Restful APIs without regard to a specific phone call.
The RestComm API version in use when this notification was generated. May be empty for events that don't have a specific API version.
An integer log level corresponding to the type of notification: 0 is ERROR, 1 is WARNING.
A unique error code for the error condition. You can lookup errors, in our Error Dictionary.
A URL for more information about the error condition. The URL is a page in our Error Dictionary.
The date the notification was actually generated
The URL of the resource that caused the notification to be generated.
The HTTP method in use for the request that caused the notification to be generated.

The HTTP GET or POST variables that RestComm generated and sent to your server. Also, if the notification was generated by the Restful APIs, this field will include any HTTP POST or PUT variables you sent.
The HTTP headers returned by your server.
The HTTP body returned by your server.
The URI for this account, relative to http://localhost:port/restcomm.

formalpara.title: HTTP GET
formalpara.para: Returns the representation of a Notification resource, including the properties above.

formalpara.title: Notification List Resource URI
formalpara.para: /2012-04-24/Accounts/{AccountSid}/Notifications

formalpara.title: HTTP GET
formalpara.para: Returns the list representation of all the Notification resources for this Account, including the properties above.
